Package it.polimi.ingsw.messages.controller

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ChooseWindowMessage
    Contains the name of the window chosen by a player at the start of the game.
    ControllerMessage
    Abstract class representing a message sent to the controller.
    LoginMessage
    Contains the username selected by a player right at the start of the match.
    LogoutMessage
    Notifies the controller of the forced disconnection of a player.
    PassMessage
    Notifies the controller that a player intend to end his turn.
    ReconnectMessage
    Notifies the controller of the reconnection of a player after being suspended for inactivity.
    SetDieMessage
    Contains the information about the placement of a die inside a window pattern, i.e.
    ShowTableRequestMessage
    Notifies the controller that a player intend to look at the cards in the game, i.e.
    ToolCardAMessage
    Contains the information about the use of a tool card number 1, 5, 6, 10 or 11 as all of them regard a die from the draft pool and usually give the player a choice between two actions, like increasing or decreasing the value of a selected die.
    ToolCardBMessage
    Contains the information about the use of a tool card number 2 or 3 as all of them let the player move a die inside his window pattern from a position (x, y) to a new position (a, b).
    ToolCardCMessage
    Contains the information about the use of a tool card number 4 or 12 as all of them let the player move two dice inside his window pattern from two different positions (x, y) and (x2, y2) to two new ones (a, b) and (a2, b2).
    ToolCardDMessage
    Contains the information about the use of a tool card number 8 or 9 as all of them let the player place a die from the draft pool inside his window pattern ignoring some restrictions.
    ToolCardEMessage
    Contains the information about the use of a tool card number 7, which in fact doesn't need any parameter.
    UnexpectedMessage
    Default class created whenever the parser fails to identify a Json string.
